121TCfMTrMXaTPOPWJIy9A.text: What a great dining experience! Where do I even begin...Upon arrival we were greeted by the friendly host staff that quickly walked us over to our table. I was taken aback by the decor and of course the view of the beautiful Singapore skyline. Once seated, our server arrived promptly and took our drink orders. He was very attentive and took the time to walk us through the menu and was confident answering the questions we had. He was there whenever we needed refills, etc. without being annoying or hovering over us the entire time. The food was excellent as well. We tried a chicken and a steak dish which were both great and came with delicious and generous sides.I thoroughly enjoyed my experience and would recommend/go there again!

photos.caption: Photo of Equinox Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Equinox Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore

oynavdt-iShndkHGQ84XDA.text: Nice view, fantastic food, good service and of course .. it's not cheap ... If you request a window table, it comes with extra charge of $20. And don't be surprise to see many of the customers who is busy taking photo than spending time to enjoy the ambience and food.

photos.caption: Photo of Equinox Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore. View from the 70th floor Swiss hotel
Photo of Equinox Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore. Wagyu tataki
Photo of Equinox Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore. Angus beef short rib

yDSqQQO44Lkj1V3GJ-Xk1w.text: 3.5 enjoyed the skybox suite view and the coursed meeting dinner was nice as well, fancy presentation, cod was done well.  make sure to face the right direction for light show.

u9A-j13BzAMglLNFoMZjWA.text: I went on the recommendation of our consierge and could not be more disappointed. To be fair, the view is spectacular but you can get this view without having to spend $300+ for a meager, mediocre, shamelessly overpriced dinner. They even charge $20 for a window table. Disgraceful. On top of everything else I had to take an Alka Seltzer when I returned to my room as the terrible pork meal made me ill. My consierge is going to hear about this!

fQ_C8e8w1H_7kNHfzb76zw.text: Great view and delicious food!I had the short rib, my husband had the duck, and my brother had the lamb. All great dishes and beautiful presentation. The views were spectacular.You should have dinner close to sunset and stay long enough to see the light show on the water below.It is the perfect way to start any trip to Singapore, especially if it is your first time!Service was excellent. Only downside is the cost.

photos.caption: Photo of Equinox Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore. Roasted pineapple for dessert!

HToezs_qw2RXoDRKoSSGpA.text: I came here with my mother for the semi-buffet lunch. It's definitely on the expensive side, but I think it's worth it to come - especially for a special occasion. The service was extremely professional and welcoming from beginning to end, which only enhanced the experience.The food selection was great, and very seafood oriented. They included things like oysters, mussels, scallops, sushi, and rolls of different kinds. They also had a good selection of other hors d'oeuvres and dessert options, ranging from cheese & crackers to chocolate dipped fruits.Make sure to see if you can get a seat by the window! The panoramic view of the city is pretty spectacular.

ZFQqssEL_TGzHVsyZ386PQ.text: I was completely underwhelmed by this pricey, dismally tired and poorly decorated restaurant. Its only redeeming feature is the spectacular view which they milk to the hilt - charging $20 for a window table in an otherwise empty restaurant. Lastly, the food was average - if even that and amazingly overpriced for the quality I was utterly disappointed and we paid $250 for this disaster.

yWFg4SHDmV0joO_eoCpncg.text: should be fours stars for the view and service. these two factors help, but the food is not as good as I expected for the price, so it's not really a good value. the bar is beautiful with huge windows 60+ floors about Singapore. getting there at sunset when the lights of the city start coming on is definitely worth itI realize drink pours in the U.S. are super generous, but a martini here was tiny. I bet it was just one ounce. I forget how much each drink was, but remember thinking it was not at all worth itthe fish was good, seemed fresh. and service was 4-star. but I'd set your expectations accordingly, i.e., you come here for a special occasion when you can sit by the window, but not for the highest level of fine dining or value

9SNFh1ioNJg1RHNOxMzi4w.text: it was a great experience dinning at this restaurant.  Maria truly made our dinner very romantic.My wife and I loved the seafood platter. Great views of Singapore too!

Rv2wQrALRWgMuodlbMloOQ.text: One of the best views and cuisine of Singapore. Taxi drivers are confused by the name swissôtel so tell them the address instead.

Z9fy1xKRm4bNeYqJ2PKRjw.text: The boyfriend took me to Equinox for their high tea buffet. Personally, I feel their high tea buffet spread was normal. Otah, soba, dim sum, chicken drumsticks, bread and a few pastries here and there. Nothing out of the ordinary. For the desserts, I tried their chocolate fondue, fruits and cakes... nothing memorable sadly. The view though, was breathtaking. You can see what feels like the whole of Singapore. Ended up feeling like I was there just to see the view, not for the food. Perhaps their lunch and dinner will be better than their high tea? I have to come back here and try it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Equinox Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore. Equinox high tea buffet food
Photo of Equinox Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore. Equinox high tea pasta sample

gIgS0jglqXzqzTFu2fwCSg.text: Being a member of the Feed At Raffles, I received a complimentary voucher redeemable for high tea for 2 people at Equinox . This voucher came in handy as one of my friends was visiting from Tokyo and Equinox will have a panoramic view of the Singapore Skyline.  We enjoyed ourselves admiring the skyline of singapore but not so for the high tea.Personally, I think that the spread for the high tea was somewhat limited and disappointing especially since its priced at $43++ per pax.

photos.caption: Photo of Equinox Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore

iv2FgbCpSfNnppaAYNj23A.text: Great food and wine. We had a perfect evening with a group.Quite expensive but worth the money

NXE4xq6KEiFvXcOVrk0ipA.text: Best view of Singapore. We were there for dinner and when the sun set, all the stars aligned,  the angels sang in unison and Singapore was lit up. We ordered the tuna tartar with avocado and it was divine. It was delightful with all it's added ingredients and all blended well when ate at once. For our main course we ordered the angus rib for two and holy holy flips on fire, while we were waiting, a waiter surprised us by showing us the HUGE piece of meat before he sliced it. We were ecstatic! I was worried because I wasn't really looking forward to the normal fine dining minuscule portions that leaves you still hungry afterwards. The beef rib was succulent and cooked perfectly. Everything was above average!

0_GPCiSJaXKPMAfgLBnetg.text: The last Sunday of every month = Pink Champagne Brunch!Went to the Pink Champagne Brunch on Sunday for a friend's birthday.  Free flowing Moet Rose Imperial and cocktails. The most gorgeously plated bacon-wrapped scallops that I've ever seen. Great seafood spread --oysters, lobsters, mussels, etc.  You can even get your picture taken with the Pink Panther.  If you can afford to splurge, the food, drinks and panoramic views of Singapore are totally worth it.

rC5BCkRzOIRI4dqJDoZ17w.text: My boyfriend took me to a dinner here for our one year anniversary. I absolutely loved it. We had a great view as we were seated right by the window. The service was fantastic and the food was delicious. We had a really good time there. From the beginning to the end it was just amazing. Would definitely want to go back there if I ever end up in Singapore again.

paWatyhlD14DC4RDN5ABLQ.text: Located at the 70th floor of Swissotel the Stamford, Equinox is helmed by Chef de Cuisine Lee Bennett and offers mainly modern European cuisine. For lunch, Equinox serves up a semi-buffet with a single order of a main course flanked by both appetizers and deserts buffet.  Lunch at Equinox usually goes for S$59++ but for restaurant week a special price of S$40++ applies instead. Sweet!Besides food, Equinox is better known for its astounding view that enables diners to glimpse beyond Singapore to the isles of Malaysia and Indonesia. We were lucky to get a table that was only a seat away from the window and was able to enjoy the magnificent view without the glare of direct sunlight upon us.The appetizers impressed with the variety as well as freshness of the offerings. From sashimi and sushi to cold seafood and foie gras and smoked salmon, the dishes were mostly well-executed and were the highlight of our meal. In particular the foie gras pate with jelly was exceptionally delicious albeit a little too rich for me to enjoy more than a single portion. The spread of cold seafood included two types of oysters, prawns, crabs as well as mussels and clams.On to the mains, which our server politely informed us would require 20 minutes for preparation and which we could request at any time while enjoying the appetizers. My guest had the Grilled Salmon Fillet with Herb Crushed Potatoes, Caper, Shallots and Tomato Salsa while I had the Roast Breast of Chicken with Pommes Purée and Chasseur Sauce. After the excellent appetizers, we were severely disappointed by the mains. The only praise that I could give was that both the chicken and salmon were cooked just right. However, this is underwhelmed by the sauces which were overpowering and which did not go well with the dishes at all. A rather uninspiring attempt and we would have been glad to skip the mains completely.Deserts consisted of ice-cream, cakes, pastries, cheeses and a chocolate fondue, among other things. I especially enjoyed the chocolate fudge with caramel and mango panna cotta which looked pretty and tasted delicious.For more pictures and the full review visit voraciousappetite.wordpr…

photos.caption: Photo of Equinox Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore. Appetizers selection

H-tbvX_ur-fwNzywxn5xSg.text: We were staying in the hotel so it was convenient to visit the bar for a drink and snack. Everything seems expensive in Singapore but by local standards it wasn't bad. I had two glasses of spanish wine. My wife had two glasses of Campari and soda. We got a Chinese duck pizza which tasted good. We were happy to have gone there. Service was ok but not amazing.

mwvJvG05lZURjNkKaw01MQ.text: Me and wifey decided to have a quiet weekend lunch without the kids at Equinox. Semi-buffet at competitive price, given the location. Overall, the food was OK (this is after all a buffet) but the breathtaking scenery and excellent service more than made up for any shortfall in food expectations. Will be back for dinner though as I hear it's good, and the night view would be ideal to romance wifey to the max!
